title: Free-to-play Mining training

properties.name: description
properties.value: This guide outlines the best methods for training the Mining skill in free-to-play. Even though mining runite ore with 85 Mining is one of the fastest free-to-play money making methods, profit from lower level ores is very low so it is more efficient to drop mined ores when training and use the saved time for other money making methods.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Free-to-play Mining training
See also: Pay-to-play Mining training

This guide outlines the best methods for training the Mining skill in free-to-play. Even though mining runite ore with 85 Mining is one of the fastest free-to-play money making methods, profit from lower level ores is very low so it is more efficient to drop mined ores when training and use the saved time for other money making methods.

Contents

  • 1 Pickaxes
  • 2 Ores
  • 3 Levels 1–99
    • 3.1 Level 1–10: Doric's Quest
    • 3.2 Levels 1/10–15: Copper ore/Tin ore
    • 3.3 Levels 15–99: Iron ore
  • 4 Money making methods
    • 4.1 Levels 30–99: Superheat Item
    • 4.2 Levels 70–85: Adamantite ore
    • 4.3 Levels 85–99: Runite ore
  • 5 Other methods
    • 5.1 Levels 1/10–14/15: Rune essences
    • 5.2 Levels 14–99: Barronite shards and deposits

Pickaxes[edit | edit source]

Pickaxes are required to train Mining, ranging from bronze to rune. Each tier up decreases the tick interval between rolls to mine an ore and thus it is recommended to always use the highest tier pickaxe available. If the Attack level requirement is met, save an inventory space by equipping the pickaxe.

Pickaxe Level Level How to obtain GE Price Weight Ticks between rolls
Bronze pickaxe 1 1 Nurmof/Bob/Yarsul (60+ Mining): 1
Spawns at:
  • Barbarian Village ( house)
  • Desert Plateau
  • Lumbridge Castle gatehouse (2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US])
  • Mining Guild building
  • Rimmington
 71 2.267 kg 8
Iron pickaxe 1 1 Nurmof/Yarsul: 140 96 2.267 kg 7
Steel pickaxe 6 5 Nurmof/Yarsul: 500 550 2.267 kg 6
Black pickaxe 11 10 Reward casket (beginner) 4,640 0.01 kg 5
Mithril pickaxe 21 20 Nurmof/Yarsul: 1,300 419 1.814 kg 5
Adamant pickaxe 31 30 Nurmof/Yarsul: 3,200 1,595 2.721 kg 4
Rune pickaxe 41 40 Nurmof/Yarsul: 32,000 18,549 2.267 kg 3

Ores[edit | edit source]

Ore Mining
Level Exp
Rune essence 1 5.0
Clay 1 5.0
Copper ore 1 17.5
Tin ore 1 17.5
Blurite ore 10 17.5
Barronite shards 14 16.0
Barronite deposit 14 32.0
Iron ore 15 35.0
Silver ore 20 40.0
Coal 30 50.0
Gold ore 40 65.0
Mithril ore 55 80.0
Adamantite ore 70 95.0
Runite ore 85 125.0

Levels 1–99[edit | edit source]

Level 1–10: Doric's Quest[edit | edit source]

It is recommended to complete Doric's Quest early on for the reward of 1,300 Mining experience, enough to level Mining from 1 to 10. It can be completed immediately by already having the required materials, 6 clay, 4 copper ore, and 2 iron ore.

While the clay and copper ore can be mined easily at level 1, the iron ore requires level 15 to mine. However, it can be obtained easily from the Grand Exchange or as an uncommon drop from dwarves which can be found near the Dwarven Mines to the east of Doric's house.

Levels 1/10–15: Copper ore/Tin ore[edit | edit source]

Mine copper and tin rocks to 15 Mining for 17.5 each. If banking the ores for Smithing, mine at the South-east Varrock mine and bank in the eastern Varrock bank, otherwise the safest and easiest location are East Lumbridge Swamp mine or the northern Dwarven Mines

  • Starting experience: 0
  • Experience needed for 15 from 0: 2,411
  • Copper ore or tin ore required for 15 from 0: 138 (2,415 experience)
  • Starting experience at 10: 1,300
  • Experience needed for 15 from 10: 1,111
  • Copper ore or tin ore required for 15 from 10: 64 (1,120 experience)

Levels 15–99: Iron ore[edit | edit source]

The fastest experience from this point onward is from iron rocks for 35 experience each. Maximise experience by dropping ores and from mining at locations where one tile is surrounded by three iron rocks for zero travel time while waiting for respawns. At 41 Mining with a rune pickaxe all three ores can be mined and the player can face back towards the first just before it respawns, allowing for non-stop mining. The only location in free-to-play with one tile surrounded by three iron ores is Al Kharid Mine, which has aggressive level 14 scorpions, but the mining spot itself is safe from them.

At 41 Mining, the maximum experience rate is around 50,000 experience per hour. Using tick manipulation, experience rates of 65,000-76,000 per hour are obtainable using an alternate account to attack the player with auto-retaliate on while in the Wilderness at the Bandit Camp mine.

  • Starting experience: 2,420
  • Experience required: 13,032,020
  • Iron ore required: 372,344 (13,032,040 experience)
  • Banking profit: 33,883,304

Money making methods[edit | edit source]

Levels 30–99: Superheat Item[edit | edit source]

Superheat Item can be used at 43 Magic and the appropriate Smithing level to smelt a bar without a furnace. This reduces the need to bank when Mining, especially for coal. Equip a staff of fire, and keep Nature runes and a pickaxe in the inventory for 26 open spaces. If purchasing the ore, bring 26 minus the amount of coal required to superheat the bar, otherwise, mine them as you mine coal. This will allow mining of a significant amount of coal between trips to the bank while producing bars:

Bar # of bars
per trip 		# of coal mined
per trip 		Profit per bar[1] Profit per trip[1] Profit to 99[1]
Steel bar 24 48 145 3,480 18,880,595
Mithril bar 22 88 393 8,646 25,586,658
Adamantite bar 20 120 702 14,040 30,469,608
Runite bar 18 144 1,355 24,390 44,109,315
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 1.2 Profit calculated assuming the ore and runes are purchased.

With an imbued Skull sceptre, the Barbarian Village mine has the closest coal rocks, and banking can be done with the Falador teleport. With a high Mining level, hopping worlds or using a different location may be required due to mining speed and coal respawn time. Otherwise, the time save is significant.

Alternative locations with an abundance of coal included: the Mining Guild, the West Lumbridge Swamp mine, the South-west Wilderness mine, and the Dwarven mine for additional mining locations. With this method, some mines located farther away than others from a bank become more viable due to bank travel taking up proportionally less time.

Levels 70–85: Adamantite ore[edit | edit source]

Mining adamantite ore can be a good free-to-play money-making method. The best place to mine adamantite is within the Mining Guild, requiring 60 Mining. It has two rocks and ores can be banked at the east Falador bank. Hopping worlds is faster than waiting for them to respawn. Mining adamantite rocks give 95 experience each. See Money making guide/Mining adamantite ore (free-to-play) for more information.

  • Starting experience: 737,627
  • Experience required: 1,935,487
  • Adamantite ore required: 20,374 (1,935,530 experience)
  • Profit: 22,472,522

Levels 85–99: Runite ore[edit | edit source]

Runite mining is highly profitable, but extremely slow and dangerous because the only runite rocks are in the Wilderness at the Lava Maze runite mine. Like adamantite, it is faster and safer to hop worlds instead of waiting for ores to respawn. Mining runite rocks give 125 experience each. See Money making guide/Mining runite ore (free-to-play) for more information.

  • Starting experience: 3,258,610
  • Experience required: 9,775,821
  • Runite ore required: 78,207 (9,775,875 experience)
  • Profit: 851,283,195

Other methods[edit | edit source]

Levels 1/10–14/15: Rune essences[edit | edit source]

With the completion or progression of Rune Mysteries, players can mine rune essences at the rune essence mine to create runes for Runecraft training later or drop them for faster Mining rates. As for training Mining, this is a slow training method with each rune essence giving 5 experience (a total of 140 Mining XP per inventory) but it's the only AFK-able training method until the player can access the Ruins of Camdozaal after completing Below Ice Mountain.

  • Starting experience: 0
  • Experience needed for 15 from 0: 2,411
  • Rune essence required for 15 from 0: 483 (2,415 experience)
  • Starting experience at 10: 1,300
  • Experience needed for 15 from 10: 953 or 1,111
  • Rune essence required for 15 from 10: 223 (1,115 experience)

Levels 14–99: Barronite shards and deposits[edit | edit source]

Completing the free-to-play Below Ice Mountain quest rewards the player with access to the Ruins of Camdozaal where you can mine barronite shards from barronite rocks. Mining barronite shards gives 16 experience each and mining barronite deposits gives 32 experience each, making this a slower training method than mining iron ore but it is very AFK-able compared to iron ore, making barronites a good training alternative to iron ore and an improvement over mining rune essences. Barronite shards can be used to purchase rewards from Ramarno and while the barronite deposits can be used for Smithing, dropping them is recommended if solely training Mining.

Purchasing the permanent Charm of Mining buff and the one-hour Charm of Boost from Ramarno's Shard Exchange yields higher experience rates.

{{External|rs}} {{See also|Pay-to-play Mining training}} This [[Skill training guides|guide]] outlines the best methods for training the [[Mining]] [[skill]] in [[free-to-play]]. Even though mining [[runite ore]] with 85 Mining is one of the fastest free-to-play money making methods, profit from lower level ores is very low so it is more efficient to drop mined ores when training and use the saved time for other money making methods. ==Pickaxes== [[Pickaxe]]s are required to train [[Mining]], ranging from [[bronze pickaxe|bronze]] to [[rune pickaxe|rune]]. Each tier up decreases the [[tick]] interval between rolls to mine an [[ore]] and thus it is recommended to always use the highest tier pickaxe available. If the [[Attack]] level requirement is met, save an inventory space by equipping the pickaxe. {|class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Pickaxe!!{{SCP|Mining}}Level!!{{SCP|Attack}}Level!!How to obtain!!GE Price!!Weight!![[Tick]]s between rolls |- |{{plinkt|Bronze pickaxe}}||1||1||[[Nurmof's Pickaxe Shop|Nurmof]]/[[Bob's Brilliant Axes|Bob]]/[[Yarsul's Prodigious Pickaxes|Yarsul]] (60+ Mining): {{Coins|1}}
Spawns at: * [[Barbarian Village]] ([[File:Spinning wheel icon.png|link=Spinning wheel]] house) * [[Desert Plateau]] * [[Lumbridge Castle]] gatehouse ({{FloorNumber|uk=2}}) * [[Mining Guild]] building * [[Rimmington]] |{{Coins|{{GEP|Bronze pickaxe}}}}||2.267 kg||8 |- |{{plinkt|Iron pickaxe}}||1||1||[[Nurmof]]/[[Yarsul]]: {{Coins|140}}||{{Coins|{{GEP|Iron pickaxe}}}}||2.267 kg||7 |- |{{plinkt|Steel pickaxe}}||6||5||[[Nurmof]]/[[Yarsul]]: {{Coins|500}}||{{Coins|{{GEP|Steel pickaxe}}}}||2.267 kg||6 |- |{{plinkt|Black pickaxe}}||11||10||[[Reward casket (beginner)]]||{{Coins|{{GEP|Black pickaxe}}}}||0.01 kg||5 |- |{{plinkt|Mithril pickaxe}}||21||20||[[Nurmof]]/[[Yarsul]]: {{Coins|1300}}||{{Coins|{{GEP|Mithril pickaxe}}}}||1.814 kg||5 |- |{{plinkt|Adamant pickaxe}}||31||30||[[Nurmof]]/[[Yarsul]]: {{Coins|3200}}||{{Coins|{{GEP|Adamant pickaxe}}}}||2.721 kg||4 |- |{{plinkt|Rune pickaxe}}||41||40||[[Nurmof]]/[[Yarsul]]: {{Coins|32000}}||{{Coins|{{GEP|Rune pickaxe}}}}||2.267 kg||3 |} ==Ores== {| class="wikitable align-center-1 align-right-3 align-right-4" !rowspan="2" colspan="2"|[[Ore]]!!colspan="2"|{{SCP|Mining|link=yes}} |- !Level!!Exp |- |{{plinkt|Rune essence}}||1||5.0 |- |{{plinkt|Clay}}||1||5.0 |- |{{plinkt|Copper ore}}||1||17.5 |- |{{plinkt|Tin ore}}||1||17.5 |- |{{plinkt|Blurite ore}}||10||17.5 |- |{{plinkt|Barronite shards}}||14||16.0 |- |{{plinkt|Barronite deposit}}||14||32.0 |- |{{plinkt|Iron ore}}||15||35.0 |- |{{plinkt|Silver ore}}||20||40.0 |- |{{plinkt|Coal}}||30||50.0 |- |{{plinkt|Gold ore}}||40||65.0 |- |{{plinkt|Mithril ore}}||55||80.0 |- |{{plinkt|Adamantite ore}}||70||95.0 |- |{{plinkt|Runite ore}}||85||125.0 |} ==Levels 1–99== ===Level 1–10: Doric's Quest=== It is recommended to complete [[Doric's Quest]] early on for the reward of 1,300 [[Mining]] [[experience]], enough to level Mining from 1 to 10. It can be completed immediately by already having the required materials, 6 [[clay]], 4 [[copper ore]], and 2 [[iron ore]]. While the clay and copper ore can be mined easily at level 1, the iron ore requires level 15 to mine. However, it can be obtained easily from the [[Grand Exchange]] or as an uncommon drop from [[Dwarf|dwarves]] which can be found near the [[Dwarven Mines]] to the east of Doric's house. ===Levels 1/10–15: Copper ore/Tin ore=== {{plinkp|Copper ore}}{{plinkp|Tin ore}} Mine [[copper rock|copper]] and [[tin rock]]s to 15 Mining for 17.5 each. If banking the ores for [[Smithing]], mine at the [[South-east Varrock mine]] and bank in the eastern [[Varrock]] [[bank]], otherwise the safest and easiest location are [[East Lumbridge Swamp mine]] or the northern [[Dwarven Mines]] * Starting [[experience]]: 0 * Experience needed for 15 from 0: 2,411 * [[Copper ore]] or [[tin ore]] required for 15 from 0: 138 (2,415 experience) * Starting [[experience]] at 10: 1,300 * Experience needed for 15 from 10: 1,111 * [[Copper ore]] or [[tin ore]] required for 15 from 10: 64 (1,120 experience) ===Levels 15–99: Iron ore=== {{plinkp|Iron ore}} The fastest experience from this point onward is from [[iron rock]]s for 35 experience each. Maximise experience by dropping ores and from mining at locations where one tile is surrounded by three iron rocks for zero travel time while waiting for respawns. At 41 Mining with a [[rune pickaxe]] all three ores can be mined and the player can face back towards the first just before it respawns, allowing for non-stop mining. The only location in free-to-play with one tile surrounded by three iron ores is [[Al Kharid Mine]], which has aggressive level 14 [[scorpion]]s, but the mining spot itself is safe from them. At 41 Mining, the maximum experience rate is around 50,000 experience per hour. If purchasing the ore, bring 26 minus the amount of coal required to superheat the bar, otherwise, mine them as you mine coal. This will allow mining of a significant amount of coal between trips to the bank while producing bars: {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan=2|Bar !# of bars

With a high [[Mining]] level, hopping worlds or using a different location may be required due to mining speed and coal respawn time. Otherwise, the time save is significant. Alternative locations with an abundance of coal included: the [[Mining Guild]], the [[West Lumbridge Swamp mine]], the [[South-west Wilderness mine]], and the [[Dwarven mine]] for additional mining locations. With this method, some mines located farther away than others from a bank become more viable due to bank travel taking up proportionally less time. ===Levels 70–85: Adamantite ore=== {{plinkp|Adamantite ore}} Mining [[adamantite ore]] can be a good free-to-play money-making method. The best place to mine adamantite is within the [[Mining Guild]], requiring 60 Mining. It has two rocks and ores can be banked at the east Falador bank. Hopping worlds is faster than waiting for them to respawn. Mining adamantite rocks give 95 experience each. Like adamantite, it is faster and safer to hop worlds instead of waiting for ores to respawn. Mining runite rocks give 125 experience each. See [[Money making guide/Mining runite ore (free-to-play)]] for more information. * Starting experience: 3,258,610 * Experience required: 9,775,821 * [[Runite ore]] required: 78,207 (9,775,875 experience) * Profit: {{Coins|{{GEP|Runite ore|78207}}}} ==Other methods== ===Levels 1/10–14/15: Rune essences=== {{plinkp|Rune essence}} With the completion or progression of [[Rune Mysteries]], players can mine [[rune essence]]s at the [[rune essence mine]] to create [[rune]]s for [[Runecraft]] training later or drop them for faster Mining rates. As for training Mining, this is a slow training method with each rune essence giving 5 experience (a total of 140 Mining XP per inventory) but it's the only AFK-able training method until the player can access the [[Ruins of Camdozaal]] after completing [[Below Ice Mountain]]. * Starting [[experience]]: 0 * Experience needed for 15 from 0: 2,411 * [[Rune essence]] required for 15 from 0: 483 (2,415 experience) * Starting [[experience]] at 10: 1,300 * Experience needed for 15 from 10: 953 or 1,111 * [[Rune essence]] required for 15 from 10: 223 (1,115 experience) ===Levels 14–99: Barronite shards and deposits=== {{plinkp|Barronite shards}}{{plinkp|Barronite deposit}} Completing the free-to-play [[Below Ice Mountain]] [[quest]] rewards the player with access to the [[Ruins of Camdozaal]] where you can mine [[barronite shards]] from [[Rocks (Barronite)|barronite rocks]]. Mining barronite shards gives 16 experience each and mining [[barronite deposit]]s gives 32 experience each, making this a slower training method than mining [[iron ore]] but it is very AFK-able compared to [[iron ore]], making barronites a good training alternative to iron ore and an improvement over mining rune essences. Barronite shards can be used to purchase rewards from [[Ramarno]] and while the barronite deposits can be used for Smithing, dropping them is recommended if solely training Mining. Purchasing the permanent [[Charm of Mining]] buff and the one-hour [[Charm of Boost]] from [[Ramarno's Shard Exchange]] yields higher experience rates. {{Training guides}} {{Free-to-play guides}} [[Category:Free-to-play]] [[Category:Mining]]
